skgl

Class SKM

  • java.lang.Object
    • skgl.SKM

  • public class SKM
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains methods to ease access to the Serial Key Manager Web API.

    Most of the methods will require variables "pid", "uid", "hsum". These values can be found on https://serialkeymanager.com/Ext/Val.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Artem Los

    • Method Detail

      • KeyActivation

        public static KeyInformation KeyActivation(ProductVariables pv,
                                           java.lang.String key,
                                           java.lang.String machineCode)
        This method will check whether the key is valid or invalid against the Serial Key Manager database. The method will return an object (KeyInformation) only if:
        the key exists in the database (it has been generated)
        the key is not blocked
        the machine code that is activated has not been activated before
        the limit for maximum number of machine codes has not been achieved
        the machine code exists in the Allowed Machine codes.
        NOTE: In Addition, depending on the settings, this method will activate a machine code.
        Parameters:
        pv -
        key -
        machineCode -
        Returns:

      • GetKeyInformationFromParameters

        public static KeyInformation GetKeyInformationFromParameters(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
        This method will interpret the input from the dictionary that was returned through "GetParameters" method, if the action was either "activate" or "validate".
        If there is an error, null will be returned.
        Parameters:
        parameters - The Map array returned in "GetParameters" method.
        Returns:
        A Key Information object. If parameters contains an error, null is returned.

      • GetParameters

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> GetParameters(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> inputParameters,
                                                                             java.lang.String typeOfAction)
        This method will take in a set of parameters (input parameters) and send them to the given action. You can find them here: http://docs.serialkeymanager.com/web-api/.

        The action that is given by typeOfAction is a short string that is located in the end of https://serialkeymanager.com/Ext/. For example, since Key Generation is normally accessed by https://serialkeymanager.com/Ext/GenKey, the typeOfAction parameter should be GenKey.

        Parameters:
        inputParameters - A map that contains data such as "uid", "pid", etc.
        typeOfAction - A string that tells what to do, i.e. "validate", "activate" etc.
        Returns:
        A map of the JSON elements returned for that particular request. If unsuccessful, null is returned.
